meanings.definition: Operate beyond the normal or acceptable limits.
meanings.sent1: The machine started overoperating, causing it to break down.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overoperate when she gets anxious, which can lead to mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The toaster was overoperating so much that it started to smoke, creating a mini firework display.
meanings.sent4: His brain was overoperating like a supercomputer, processing information at lightning speed.
meanings.sent5: The car engine was overoperating, roaring like a hungry lion.

meanings.definition: To function excessively or too much.
meanings.sent1: The old computer was overoperating, struggling to keep up with the demands.
meanings.sent2: When stressed, she tends to overoperate, trying to do too many things at once.
meanings.sent3: The clock was overoperating, ticking so loudly that it drowned out all other sounds.
meanings.sent4: His heart was overoperating, beating rapidly like a drum in a marching band.
meanings.sent5: The fan was overoperating, spinning so fast it created a small breeze in the room.
